frame.name: Amalgamation
frame.definition:
<def-root>These words refer to <fen>Parts</fen> merging to form a <fen>Whole</fen>. (The <fen>Parts</fen> may also be encoded as <fen>Part_1</fen> and <fen>Part_2</fen>.) There is a symmetrical relationship between the components that undergo the process, and afterwards the <fen>Parts</fen> are consumed and are no longer distinct entities that are easily discernable or separable in the <fen>Whole</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Parts">The two droplets</fex> <t>merge</t>, and then travel down the windowpane even faster.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Parts
FE.definition: <def-root>The entities that merge to form a single <fen>Whole</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition:
<def-root>The single, undifferentiated entity that is the result of the amalgamation.
<ex>They had all just <t>merged</t> <fex name="Whole">into one big file</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part_1
FE.definition: <def-root>The prominent entity that combines with <fen>Part_2</fen> to form a <fen>Whole</fen>. <ex><fex name="Part_1">The single smaller soul</fex> <t>merges</t> with the Ur-soul.</ex></def-root >

FE.name: Part_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>The less focussed-upon entity that the <fen>Part_1</fen> merges with.
<ex>The single smaller soul <t>merges</t> <fex name="Part_2">with the Ur-soul</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the thoroughness of the mixing job, i.e. to what degree the resulting <fen>Whole</fen> is undifferentiated.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In this frame, it is also deemed to include modification indicating the speed of the event.</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Parts</fen> after the amalgamation.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Parts</fen> become amalgamated into a <fen>Whole</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location at which the amalgamation occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Descriptor</fen> describes the target. Usually adjectives, used with noun LUs.
<ex>This <fex name="Descriptor">beautiful</fex> <t>combination</t> is only available for a limited time.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: merger.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the combining of two things, especially companies, into one.

lexUnit.name: amalgamate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: combine or unite to form one organization or structure.

lexUnit.name: blend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to mix with something else

lexUnit.name: combine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: unite; merge; unite to form a compound

lexUnit.name: commingle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to blend together with another item or substance

lexUnit.name: fuse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to blend together with one or more additional entities

lexUnit.name: intermix.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to blend together with one or more additional items

lexUnit.name: meld.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to blend together with at least one additional item

lexUnit.name: merge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be combined into one

lexUnit.name: unify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become united or uniform.

lexUnit.name: unite.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to combine with one or more additional entities to form a whole

lexUnit.name: band together.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: people forming a group, usually for some specific purpose

lexUnit.name: come together.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: coalesce to make a whole

lexUnit.name: combination.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a mixture of two or more parts which forms a single, new whole

lexUnit.name: coalesce.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to come together to form one mass

lexUnit.name: consolidate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to come together to form a single unit

lexUnit.name: join.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to come together to form a single unit

lexUnit.name: jumble.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to come together in an unorganized or confusing manner

lexUnit.name: mix.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to come together to form one unit
